de.tuberlin.pserver.math.matrix

Interface Matrix

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ApplyOnDoubleElements<Matrix>, java.io.Serializable, SharedObject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMatrix, Dense64Matrix, DistributedMatrix, RemoteMatrixSkeleton, RemoteMatrixStub, Sparse64Matrix

    public interface Matrix
extends SharedObject, ApplyOnDoubleElements<Matrix>

      • add

        Matrix add(Matrix B)
        Identical to add(Matrix, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix C.

      • add

        Matrix add(Matrix B,
           Matrix C)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes Matrix-Matrix-Addition C = A + B and returns C.
        Note: A, B and C have to be of the same shape
        Parameters:
        B - Matrix to add on A
        C - Matrix to store the result in
        Returns:
        C after computing C = A + B
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shapes of C, B and A are not equal

      • sub

        Matrix sub(Matrix B)
        Identical to sub(Matrix, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix C.

      • sub

        Matrix sub(Matrix B,
           Matrix C)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes Matrix-Matrix-Subtraction C = A - B and returns C.
        Note: A, B and C have to be of the same shape
        Parameters:
        B - Matrix to subtract from A
        C - Matrix to store the result in
        Returns:
        C after computing C = A - B
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shapes of C, B and A are not equal

      • mul

        Matrix mul(Matrix B)
        Identical to mul(Matrix, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix C.

      • mul

        Matrix mul(Matrix B,
           Matrix C)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes Matrix-Matrix-Multiplication C = A * B and returns C.
        Note: A, B and C have to be of shapes n x m, m x o and n x o respectively
        Parameters:
        B - Matrix to multiply with A. Of shape m x o
        C - Matrix to store the result in. Of shape n x o
        Returns:
        C after computing C = A * B
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If A.cols() != B.rows() or A.rows() != C.rows() or B.cols() != C.cols()

      • scale

        Matrix scale(double a)
        Identical to scale(double, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • scale

        Matrix scale(double a,
             Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes Matrix-Scalar-Multiplication B = A * a.
        Note: A and B have to be of the same shape
        Parameters:
        a - Scalar to multiply with A
        B - Matrix to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing B = A * a
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shapes of B and A are not equal

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose()
        Identical to transpose(Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose(Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes transpose of A: B = AT.
        Note: A is wlog. of shape n x m. B has to be of shape m x n
        Parameters:
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing B = AT
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If A.rows() != B.cols() or A.cols() != B.rows()

      • invert

        Matrix invert()
        Identical to invert(Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • invert

        Matrix invert(Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes inverse of A: B = A-1.
        Note: A is wlog. of shape n x m. B has to be of shape m x n
        Parameters:
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing B = A-1
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If A.rows() != B.cols() or A.cols() != B.rows()
        SingularMatrixException - If A is singular an its inverse can not be computed

      • applyOnElements

        Matrix applyOnElements(Matrix.MatrixElementUnaryOperator f)
        Identical to applyOnElements(MatrixElementUnaryOperator) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • applyOnElements

        Matrix applyOnElements(Matrix.MatrixElementUnaryOperator f,
                       Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes B = f(A) element-wise.
        Note: A and B have to be of the same shape
        Parameters:
        f - Unary higher order function f: (row, col, val) -> new_val
        B - Matrix to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing B = f(A) element-wise.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If the shapes of B and A are not equal

      • applyOnNonZeroElements

        Matrix applyOnNonZeroElements(Matrix.MatrixElementUnaryOperator f)
        Identical to ApplyOnDoubleElements.applyOnElements(DoubleUnaryOperator) but only on non-zero elements.

      • applyOnNonZeroElements

        Matrix applyOnNonZeroElements(Matrix.MatrixElementUnaryOperator f,
                              Matrix B)
        Identical to ApplyOnDoubleElements.applyOnElements(DoubleUnaryOperator) but only on non-zero elements.

      • addVectorToRows

        Matrix addVectorToRows(Matrix v)
        Identical to addVectorToRows(Matrix, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • addVectorToRows

        Matrix addVectorToRows(Matrix v,
                       Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes b = a + v for each row-vector a and b in A and B respectively. Note: It has to hold that A.cols() == v.length(). Also, A and B have to be of the same shape.
        Parameters:
        v - Vector to add on each row-vector in A
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing b = a + v for each row-vector a and b in A and B respectively.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If A.cols() != v.length() or if A and B are of different shapes.

      • addVectorToCols

        Matrix addVectorToCols(Matrix v)
        Identical to addVectorToCols(Matrix, Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • addVectorToCols

        Matrix addVectorToCols(Matrix v,
                       Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Computes b = a + v for each column-vector a and b in A and B respectively. Note: It has to hold that A.rows() == v.length(). Also, A and B have to be of the same shape.
        Parameters:
        v - Vector to add on each col-vector in A
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after computing b = a + v for each column-vector a and b in A and B respectively.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleShapeException - If A.rows() != v.length() or if A and B are of different shapes.

      • setDiagonalsToZero

        Matrix setDiagonalsToZero()
        Identical to setDiagonalsToZero(Matrix) but automatically creates the resulting Matrix B.

      • setDiagonalsToZero

        Matrix setDiagonalsToZero(Matrix B)
        Called on Matrix A. Sets B = A with diagonal entries equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        B - to store the result in
        Returns:
        B after setting B = A with diagonal entries equal to zero.
